abstract: Berlin exposition Mass Shootings: The Holocaust from the Baltic to the Black Sea 1941-1944 is first German exhibit to focus solely on executions of over two million Jews and other minorities by Nazis in Soviet Union in 1941; event, known as 'Holocaust of the bullets,' is deeply familiar to citizens of former Soviet Union but has been overshadowed in Germany by horrors of gas chambers and concentration camps.

keywords.value: Mass Shootings: The Holocaust From the Baltic to the Black Sea 1941-1944 (Exhibit)
keywords.name: creative_works

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: A new display in Berlin is the first in Germany to focus solely on the executions of more than two million people after the invasion of the Soviet Union.
snippet: A new display in Berlin is the first in Germany to focus solely on the executions of more than two million people after the invasion of the Soviet Union....

headline.main: Germany Confronts, in Unique Exhibit, Its ‘Holocaust of the Bullets’
headline.print_headline: Germany Confronts, in a Unique Exhibit, Its ‘Holocaust of the Bullets’
